tests.report.overall: The cognitive test measures a person’s general capabilities. The test includes questions within verbal, numerical and abstract reasoning. The overall score represents the candidate’s total general reasoning ability across the three test sections. Speed and accuracy scores are compared to the norm group.
tests.report.elaborated: The results of the three test sections are compared to results from a large, international norm group. The candidate’s test results are shown in percentiles; the percentage of people in the norm group compared to whom the candidate has performed equally well or better.
candidate.tests.personality.title: Personality test
candidate.tests.logical.title: Ability test
candidate.tests.personality.description: The personality test PAPI 3 explores your personal preferences in a work context. The questionnaire consists of statements about workplace behavior and takes about 15 minutes to complete (but is not time limited). Please answer as fast and intuitively as possible. The questionnaire must be completed in one session, so we recommend that you do it in quiet surroundings without too many distractions.<0></0><0></0>Your test results are reported in 26 scales from 1-10. A score of 10 indicates a stronger preference than the norm group and a score of 1 represents a lower preference than the norm group. Remember there is no “bad” personality and that this merely reflects preferences. All scores will thus have advantages and disadvantages.
candidate.tests.logical.description: The cognitive capacity test Logiks is a timed 12-minute test consisting of 50 questions which you must answer in one session. You will experience time pressure during the test. It is thus important that you are clearheaded and sit in a quiet and undisturbed place while completing it.<0></0><0></0>As your test results will be part of the assessment of your qualifications during the recruitment process, it is important that you avoid being disturbed or interrupted as this will inevitably affect your results.<0></0><0></0>The test assesses your general cognitive capacity. It covers three parts in which you’ll work with different types of information: verbal, numerical and abstract. The results tell us something about how you acquire new knowledge, how you prioritize your time and how you manage time pressure.
candidate.tests.attention.text: You do not have to complete the two tests in one sitting, and you decide in which order you prefer to do them. That is, you can do the PAPI test while on the train on your way home from work and then wait until the next morning when you are clearheaded and undisturbed to do the Logiks test.<0></0><0></0>If you experience any technical issues and need to retake a test, please contact us on info@marchermarkholt.com.
candidate.tests.results.calculationInPro: Test results are being calculated and will appear in about 5 minutes.
